title: NBA Daily Rundown: All-Star Weekend Kicks Off!
subtitle: February 14, 2026 Edition

items.headline: All-Star Saturday Night Lights Up Los Angeles!
items.summary: The NBA All-Star Weekend heats up today with All-Star Saturday Night, featuring the highly anticipated State Farm 3-Point Contest, Kia Shooting Stars, and AT&T Slam Dunk competition, all taking place at the Intuit Dome in Inglewood.

items.headline: NBA Legend Chris Paul Announces Retirement After 21 Seasons
items.summary: Point God Chris Paul has officially announced his retirement from the NBA, concluding an illustrious 21-season career. The 12-time All-Star, known for his exceptional passing and defense, shared his decision during the All-Star Weekend festivities.

items.headline: LeBron, Doncic All-Star Status Unclear Amidst Injuries; Flagg Out of Rising Stars
items.summary: LeBron James' availability for the All-Star Game remains uncertain due to left foot arthritis, despite his record-setting triple-double last night. Fellow All-Star Luka Doncic (LAL) is also sidelined with a hamstring strain. Meanwhile, 2025 top overall pick Cooper Flagg (DAL) missed the Rising Stars Challenge due to a sprained foot. Giannis Antetokounmpo, Stephen Curry, and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander are also out of the All-Star game due to injuries.

items.headline: Lakers Outduel Mavericks as LeBron Makes History
items.summary: LeBron James led the Lakers to a 124-104 victory over the Mavericks, becoming the oldest player in NBA history to record a triple-double.

items.headline: Trail Blazers Dominate Jazz Behind Holiday's Big Night
items.summary: The Portland Trail Blazers secured a 135-119 win against the Utah Jazz, with Jrue Holiday scoring a season-best 31 points.

items.headline: Bucks Handle Thunder in Shai-less Matchup
items.summary: Milwaukee defeated Oklahoma City 110-93. Ousmane Dieng shined with a season-high 19 points and 11 rebounds for his first career double-double.

items.headline: Thunder Roll Past Suns Despite SGA Absence
items.summary: The Oklahoma City Thunder, even without Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, secured a dominant 136-109 victory over the Phoenix Suns, with Jalen Williams scoring 28 points.

items.headline: Spurs Extend Win Streak to Six, Beat Warriors
items.summary: The San Antonio Spurs continued their hot streak, defeating the Golden State Warriors 126-113 for their sixth consecutive win.

items.headline: LeBron James Makes History
items.summary: At 41 years and 44 days old, LeBron James (LAL) became the oldest player in NBA history to record a triple-double, putting up 28 points, 12 assists, and 10 rebounds against the Mavericks.

items.headline: Jrue Holiday Leads Blazers
items.summary: Jrue Holiday (POR) posted a season-best 31 points, along with 9 rebounds and 7 assists, in the Trail Blazers' victory over the Jazz.

items.headline: Donovan Clingan's Double-Double Dominance
items.summary: Donovan Clingan (POR) delivered a strong performance with 23 points, 18 rebounds, and 7 assists in Portland's win against Utah.

items.headline: Ousmane Dieng's First Career Double-Double
items.summary: Ousmane Dieng (MIL) recorded his first career double-double with a season-high 19 points and 11 rebounds in the Bucks' win over the Thunder.

items.headline: Deni Avdija Managing Back Injury
items.summary: Israeli forward Deni Avdija (POR) was listed with a lower back injury for the Trail Blazers' game against the Jazz, though he recently showcased strong form with 26 points, 10 rebounds, and 8 assists against the 76ers on February 9th.

items.headline: V.J. Edgecombe Named Rising Stars MVP
items.summary: Philadelphia 76ers rookie V.J. Edgecombe, the third overall pick in the 2025 draft, was named the MVP of the NBA Rising Stars Challenge after leading Team Vince to victory.

items.headline: Spurs Reportedly Eyeing Klay Thompson for Wembanyama Duo
items.summary: The San Antonio Spurs are reportedly exploring a trade for Dallas Mavericks guard Klay Thompson to bolster their roster around Victor Wembanyama and push for playoff contention in the 2025-26 season.

items.headline: Lakers Predicted to Pursue Jazz's Walker Kessler
items.summary: The Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly linked to a potential trade for Utah Jazz center Walker Kessler, aiming to strengthen their interior defense and secure long-term stability at the center position amidst LeBron James' impending free agency.

items.headline: Eastern Conference Playoff Picture
items.summary: As of February 13th, the Detroit Pistons lead the Eastern Conference with a 40-13 record, followed by the Boston Celtics (35-19) and New York Knicks (35-20).

items.headline: Western Conference Playoff Picture
items.summary: In the Western Conference, the Oklahoma City Thunder hold the top spot with a 42-14 record, with the San Antonio Spurs (38-16) close behind at second place. The Denver Nuggets (35-20) and Houston Rockets (33-20) round out the top four.

items.headline: Rome Flynn Repeats as All-Star Celebrity Game MVP
items.summary: Actor Rome Flynn secured his second consecutive All-Star Celebrity Game MVP award, dropping 17 points for the winning Team Giannis.
